eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages

Class NetworkMessageEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessage
      • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessageEvent

  • public class NetworkMessageEvent
extends NetworkMessage
    This extension of NetworkMessage is adapted to facilitate event mechanism. Event messages are different from requests and responses - they are not a part of any request between two objects (therefore they don't fill request ID), they don't carry error indication, status code, status reason etc. They also flow in 'different direction' (from the serving object to client object). Although the destination OID is not passed in the arriving JSON (that would necessitate creating separate instances of this class for every subscriber the event is meant for, filling it and building a JSON string out of it - imagine doing this for 1000s subscribers) it is filled AFTER ARRIVAL to the subscriber's OGWAPI, which has that information directly from the communication engine. We can say that the event message is actually completed not before it travels all the way to its destination :). Although it can sound weird and removing the behaviour will NOT affect the protocol, it makes the processing of the message much easier. If there are any modification to this class, they will probably be about extending the range of fields that will be transported over the network. Don't forget to put the new field into the parser and builder. Note that such modification will make the new OGWAPI incompatible with the previous versions.
    Author:
    sulfo

        Constructor of an event message that is to be sent across the network.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        sourceOid - Object ID of the publisher,
        eventId - Event ID.
        eventBody - Event body.
        parameters - Parameters to be sent alongside the body.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

                           org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                           java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        This constructor attempts to build this object by parsing incoming JSON. If the parsing operation is not successful, the result is an object with validity flag set to false.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON that arrived from the network.
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

      • buildMessageString

        public java.lang.String buildMessageString()

        JSON String that can be sent over the network.
